definition: proprietor of a shop or restaurant/landlord/shop

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I commanded him to take the mission seriously.
sentences.chinese: 我嚴辭請求店家認真對待這個任務。

sentences.english: Shops close and reinforce their windows with tape.
sentences.chinese: 店家打了烊，還用膠帶強化窗戶。

sentences.english: It’s raised paw is said to beckon customers and money into shops.
sentences.chinese: 它那舉着的小爪子意來爲店家招攬客人和錢財。

sentences.english: Archaeologist, David Parham, is in the team leading the excavation of the store rooms.
sentences.chinese: 帶領挖掘這些店家，團隊領導人是考古學家帕汗。

sentences.english: In the past, she was during the pre-mixed ingredient that bought from the shop which the smell was mild.
sentences.chinese: 以前她是在店家購買已調好味道溫和的原料。

sentences.english: The store owner displayed his most valuable items in a glass case .
sentences.chinese: 店家把他最值錢的物品放在玻璃櫃裏展示。

sentences.english: If you want to be at peace with yourself, return the stolen money to the store.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想心安理得那就把偷來的前還回店家。

sentences.english: I bought this shirt after they marked it down to ten dollars.
sentences.chinese: 我在店家把價格降到十元時買了件襯衫。

sentences.english: On that day, a shop owner also produced a giant horseshoe shape cake.
sentences.chinese: 當日，一店家還製作出一塊巨型馬蹄糕。
